I'd highly recommend "Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising" if you enjoy comedies with a bit of edge and unconventional situations. Kiersey Clemons, Chloë Grace Moretz, and Ike Barinholtz deliver hilarious performances in this film about a war between neighbors and a sorority.

If you're interested in a more profound comedy-drama with an iconic cast, "Annie Hall" is a classic that might appeal to you. Woody Allen and Diane Keaton star as two ex-lovers reflecting on their relationship in this thoughtful film that explores love, humor, and life's complexities.

I'd highly recommend checking out "Mrs. Doubtfire" from 1993, starring the talented Robin Williams. The film is a heartwarming comedy about an actor disguising himself as a female housekeeper to spend time with his children after a divorce. It's a delightful watch!

If you're up for something more contemporary set in 1978, consider "Yogi Bear." This animated adventure features Josh Robert Thompson and Justin Timberlake and follows the lovable Yogi Bear as he navigates life at Jellystone Park. It's a fun-filled family comedy!

Another recommendation would be Rushmore, directed by Wes Anderson. It's a quirky comedy with an all-star cast including Jason Schwartzman, Bill Murray, and Olivia Williams. Enjoy the laughs!

If you're in the mood for something more lighthearted and comedic, "Witless Protection" might be a fun choice. It stars Larry the Cable Guy and follows the misadventures of a small-town sheriff trying to save a damsel in distress. Enjoy!

This movie is a compelling drama with a star-studded cast, including Glenn Close, John Lithgow, and Robin Williams. Although Christian Berkel isn't in it, the story of a young writer dealing with family dynamics might appeal to you.

If you're looking for an action-packed thriller, "End of Watch" (2016) starring Jake Gyllenhaal could be another great choice. It follows two LA police officers and their encounters with dangerous criminal forces.

If you're open to exploring a contemporary teen movie, "10 Things I Hate About You" (1999) might also interest you. This modern adaptation of Shakespeare's Taming of the Shrew features Heath Ledger and Joseph Gordon-Levitt in a captivating story about love and high school drama.

I'd highly recommend watching "The Devil's Advocate" starring Keanu Reeves and Al Pacino. The story revolves around a talented lawyer who lands an opportunity at a prestigious New York City law firm, only to uncover some shocking truths. It's a gripping thriller that you might really enjoy!

If you prefer a more recent film, "Michael Clayton" is another fantastic choice. George Clooney delivers a captivating performance in this legal drama about a fixer who gets embroiled in a multibillion-dollar class action suit. It's an engaging movie that blends mystery and drama beautifully.
